item.title: Methods: Bayesian trees
item.description: Introduction The fundamental idea that underpins all machine learning is that of the universal approximator, that is, a function that is so flexible that it can be used to model any dataset. Trees provide one way to construct such a flexible function. The code below simulates a small regression problem that I will use to illustrate the discussion of Bayesian tree models. # --- create an example dataset ------------------------------ set.
